job description:
The Firmware Design Engineer will be involved in all aspects of the firmware development life cycle: concept development and feasibility assessment, firmware architecture and design, writing test protocols, verification on prototype hardware, and documentation. Broad experience in microprocessors, embedded operating systems, wireless technologies such as Bluetooth or MICS, data acquisition and processing is required. Previous experience in firmware design and testing for Class II and III medical devices under IEC 62304 guidelines is highly desirable.

Essential Functions:

Key responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

·
Assist in the generation of proposals for feasibility, development, and verification

·
Participate in the development of system architecture and detailed electrical design to meet customer requirements.

·
Documentation of firmware requirements and architecture, block diagramming of code

·
Estimation and scheduling of firmware tasks

·
Writing firmware functions in a well-documented, modular style with debug capability and proper error handling

·
Configuration of u-boot for loading an OS onto a 32-bit microcontroller from FLASH

·
Configuration of the OS Kernel Device Tree

·
Development or configuration of software drivers for communication protocols (USB, BLE, I2C, SPI, UART, etc.)

·
Writing interrupt service routines and configuration of an RTOS to meet latency requirements

·
Solid understanding of TCP/IP protocol layers and experience working with common MAC/PHY devices

·
Working knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, BASH, or Perl

·
Writing build scripts

·
Working knowledge of development environments such as MPLAB, Gnu tools

·
Troubleshooting experience with logic analyzers, oscilloscopes, microprocessor debuggers, communication protocol analyzers

·
Experience writing “bare metal” firmware for 8 and 16-bit microcontrollers.

·
Ability to understand electrical schematics for digital systems

·
Assist in the failure mode analysis of the hardware/firmware device.

·
Participation in design reviews

·
Collaborate effectively with other engineers, sales, quality, purchasing, mechanical, system test, and manufacturing departments to assist in manufacturing transfer efforts.

Education and Skills

Bachelor or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering or Computer Science with 5+ years of relevant work experience with embedded firmware design for 32-bit microcontrollers. Experience should include embedding operating systems such as Linux, developing software drivers for peripherals, and troubleshooting communications protocols such as Gigabit Ethernet, USB, Bluetooth, I2C, and SPI. Previous experience under ISO 62304 and FDA design controls is highly desirable
